description:
The role:

The National Sales Director oversees B2B sales for the United States, Canada (maybe Mexico) and is responsible for management, business development and sales growth, of the B2B (business, distributor, retailer and trade professionals) channels of Buster + Punch. In addition, the National Sales Director is responsible for managing the B+P regional sales managers, the independent rep network, client relationships, B2B sales staff/team – and will implement the proper reporting and analyzing tools – with matrixes to properly manage the sales teams and the aggressive (yet strategic) sale initiatives required. This position reports to the President of Buster and Punch, Inc.

Responsibility:

The director is responsible overseeing the B2B sales channels for Buster + Punch North America. The main initial focus is the United States, however this position supports the requirements of President handling Mexico and Canada (and any other territories/markets brought on). The director also is responsible for integration with the parent company related to global sales, branding strategies and initiatives – when and as required. The director must be fully entrenched in the brand and have a deep understanding of the technical and functional aspects of all products and categories brought to market. This is a hand’s-on position where direct training, presenting, pitching and selling of the Buster + Punch brand is required.

Additional responsibilities include:
• Buster + Punch (North America) strategic sales growth planning, and metrics management
• Energize, coach and nurture an outside and inside B2B sales team to build an enthusiastic and engaged group/culture that is highly driven to generate profitable sales and exceptional customer service
• Build and nurture productive industry relationships, and effectively work with A+D industry individuals and groups – to build and increase direct-sales opportunities and relationships
• Build and develop project based opportunities within hospitality and boutique multi-residential projects Produce sales budgeting and forecasting – for internal team and as required for COO, CFO and President
• Direct and collaborate with President for new business and market opportunities – stay on top of the initiatives required of President when out in field
• Lead outside sales teams in tactical and strategic efforts to serve clients/dealers and secure renewal of programs – leading to client retention and organic growth
• Collaborate and support marketing and sales initiatives of Buster + Punch – global and local basis - related to product launches/releases, procedures, and brand exposure
• Develop and direct the creation of dealer and rep sales collateral/marketing materials, and communication tools – to deliver efficient, nimble and “real-time” implementation of any requirement or initiative
• Support and promote the Buster + Punch brand merchandising programs and disciplines required to properly represent the brand – required for the North American market
• Provide strategic advice to the board and president so that they will have accurate view of the sales, product requirements and status of Buster + Punch in the marketplace
• Provide monthly reporting to the Board on sales performance and status of high-profile opportunities
• Delegate responsibilities and supervise the work of regional and territory sales managers/team, providing guidance and motivation to drive maximum performance
• Analyze problematic situations and occurrences and provide solutions to ensure company wellbeing and growth
• Be available and have attitude to jump in as needed to fix things – including having to travel, be in the trenches – and be able to work with all senior team members – to get things done.

Requirements and skills:
• Proven experience as a national sales director or manager
• Demonstrable experience in developing strategic sales plans – including working with retailers, distributors – from single boutique partners to multi-national businesses
• Strong understanding of corporate finance and measures of performance
• Excellent organizational and leadership skills
• Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
• Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities
• Personable, available, and accessible attitude and demeanor
• Looking for opportunities to increase efficiencies and processes across the business
• Develop reporting tools to monitor ongoing performance of sales managers related teams
• Setting KPI’s to gauge team, departments, retail partners and total sales team’s performance

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Paid time off

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):
• Have you been involved in a sales or managerial role in the following industries? (Please state all that apply)

a. Fashion – apparel
b. Fashion - jewelry
c. Wellness and Fitness Products
d. Lifestyle accessories and soft goods
e. Sports ware (apparel, foot ware, and accessories)
• Have you managed a national network of independent sales rep agencies? Please detail
• Have you managed and directed regional or territory sales managers? Please detail
• Have you been involved in a sales or managerial role in the following industries? (Please state all that apply)

a. Interior Design
b. Decorative hardware or plumbing
c. Decorative lighting
d. Furniture
e. Architectural, Interior or Exterior Products
f. Home Décor – Products for residential, hospitality, commercial, workspaces
g. Kitchen and/or Bath Products
h. Major Appliances for residential
i. Home automation Products

Experience:
• Sales management: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote
